name: PathoTeSTICK
description: The PathoTeSTICK is a portable testing device that gives results in maximum 5 minutes. It needs 50 μL if tested with a drop of sample or 2 mL if testing with the stick immersed in the sample

items.description: To use the PathoTeSTICK, it is necessary to wear Individual Protection Equipment (IPEs), including but not limited to:

checklistItems.name: Disposable shoe covers or adequate shoes

items.description: It is necessary to check that the PathoTeSTICK field test kit is complete, and that it contains the following material:

checklistItems.name: 2. Mini-potentiostat - Interface between smartphone and sensor (connects with USB-C port)

items.description: While handling the sensor sticks, it is necessary to NOT TOUCH the sensing part.
steps: Take out sensor stick from the storage box (as many as needed)
The sensing part has a circular shape, with three electrodes.
The three contacts that connect to the mini-potentiostat can be seen at the other end.
Connect the mini-potentiostat to the Smartphone with the USB-C port.
A blue LED should light up on the mini-potentiostat
Launch PathoSENSE PathoTeSTICK app on smartphone
Make sure to enable location access
Click on the “...” menu and click on 'connect' to allow connection with the potentiostat in the app.
A message will be displayed on succesful connection
Create a session by clicking on the “+” icon and assigning a name to the session.
Choose the water matrix type that will be tested (drinking, waste or surface water)
Grasp the stick by the sides and connect it to the potentiostat with the contacts part (opposite end of sensing part).
AVOID TOUCHING THE SENSING PART!!
you can touch the middle Blue part with the logo

items.section: Running a test and posting results
steps: Immerse the sensor stick in the sample with the sensing part fully submerged.
Press 'Take Sample' button to start the measurement.
HOLD STILL DURING MEASUREMENT!!
Wait until you see the message- 'Plot is finished'
Presence/ of Bacteria will be indicated by 'is present' (red)/ 'OK' (green)
Click on the “...” menu and then 'Post' to send results to server
